text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with how to do those cool grill
marks by the way part of my voice I just
flew in from New York City last night
long trip so I'm a little hoarse and boy
are my arms tired
alright here we go how to make grill
marks so easy it works with any kind of
meat now what you need to do was use a
method called 10 and 2 I'm gonna pick
that pointy end of the chicken breast
and I'm gonna have that pointed towards
where 10 o'clock would be on a clock
face after a few minutes I'm gonna turn
it so the pointy end is now sort of
pointing towards 2 o'clock that's the
old 10 & 2 method and when you turn that
over you're gonna get those beautiful
diagonal diamond shaped lines that
everybody loves
especially magazine editors because
every grilled piece of meat on the cover
has those by the way proven fact
diagonal lines look better than straight
lines so if you're wondering why doesn't
he do 12 and 3 that's why it works with
any kind of meat the steak did not have
a pointy and like the chicken breast but
I just picked out that corner right
there that works so going towards 10
then going towards 2 and when you flip
it over you're like hey where's the
other marks it doesn't work as well on
red meat so the darker the meat the less
you're gonna see the crosshatch unless
your grill is like super hot but for
light meats like chicken fish pork chops
works fantastic give it a try so easy I
wanted to get that ready for Memorial
Day barbecues even though I flew all
night that's how much I love you guys
have a great long holiday weekend I hope
all your food's delicious and as always
enjoy
you
